abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Agricultural Sector
            Adjustment Credit Project fin Uganda are as follows: overall
            outcome of the project rated as satisfactory; and
            performance of the Bank and the Borrower also rated as
            satisfactory. Some of the lessons learned from the project
            are: (a) impressive achievements were made under the
            project, particularly in the areas of policy reforms in the
            liberalization of the coffee sub-sector, and in facilitating
            the establishment of institutions for coffee development
            (UCDA) and national research (NARO); (b) the survival of
            Coffee Marketing Board (CMB) was necessary to avoid a total
            collapse in the industry at the time of deregulation, and
            this was reflected in the project's design. When market
            reforms are being introduced, it is important that there is
            a phased entry of private sector participation; and (c)
            capacity building and gaining experience in procurement is
            critical for smooth implementation and takes time.
            Centralizing procurement for a multi-agency implemented
            project helped in this area.
